TopicTitle: Dynamic Aerospace Ventures - Warplanes, first release

Articles.Content:
Hey guys, I don't submit much, but I've been working on a few versatile war planes in the latest release, and thought I'd share them here for the rest of you. All my aircraft are stock .90.

I've included 4 warplanes, a ground attack aircraft, a mid range fighter/attack aircraft, a long range nuclear bomber, and a high altitude reconnaissance bomber.

DAV K-10 Stormtrooper:

The K-10 is a close ground attack plane, with 10 short range guided missiles and some amazing dexterity at ground level, capable of turning sharp corners at full thrust, with and and without armaments, thanks to it's high-mounted engines and large tailplane. Missiles are dispatched in pairs using action groups 1-5

DAV FA-88 Scarface:

The FA-88 is a versatile, maneuverable, medium altitude Air-Ground, Air-Air, and Air-Orbit fighter, with eight guided missiles and four heavy bombs, deployed using action groups 2-6. You can kill land based targets as easily as you can take out spy satellites and enemy aircraft with this one.

DAV NB-45 Lancelot:

The NB-45 is a high altitude nuclear launch platform, armed with a two-stage nuclear missile, capable of taking out any target on Kerbin, in orbit, or on the Mun. Action group 1 opens the cargo bay doors, while group 2 deploys the missile vertically using seperatrons. Group 3 fires the second stage engines

DAV SR-11 Skylark:

The SR-11 is a high altitude spy-reconnaissance aircraft, capable of comfortably cruising at over 2000m/s and above 25 kilometers. It has no armaments, primarily, because nothing has been able to catch it yet, not even Kim Il Sung.

The four aircraft are available below, in a zipped file, if you care to try them out:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/cz0aasxxsdku9io/Dynamic-Aerospace-Ventures.rar?dl=0

Edited January 17, 2015 by Agent86
